entry.title: The Counter-Terrorism Act 2008 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order brings sections 19 to 21 of the Counter-Terrorism Act 2008 into force on the day after the day on which it is made.

entry.title: The Kent County Council (Milton Creek Bridge) (No. 2) Scheme 2007 Confirmation Instrument 2008
entry.summary: This Instrument confirms a Scheme to construct over the navigable waters of Milton Creek a bridge as part of the highway which is to be constructed from the roundabout joining Swale Way and Ridham Avenue, Kemsley to the roundabout joining Castle Road and Swale Way, Sittingbourne, in the Borough of Swale in the County of Kent.

entry.title: The Housing Benefit (Executive Determinations) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Housing Benefit (Executive Determinations) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008.

entry.title: The Armed Forces (Alignment of Service Discipline Acts) (No. 2) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Armed Forces (Alignment of Service Discipline Acts) (No. 2) Order 2008
The Armed Forces (Alignment of Service Discipline Acts) (No. 2) Order 2008

entry.summary: Articles 2, 3 and 4 replace those provisions of the Army Act 1955, the Air Force Act 1955 and the Naval Discipline Act 1957 that provide for the appointment of a qualified officer to be the prosecuting authority for the relevant service. The new provisions correspond to section 364 of the Armed Forces Act 2006 which provides for Her Majesty to appoint any person who is qualified in accordance with that section as the Director of Service Prosecutions. Article 5 makes transitory provisions.

entry.title: The Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (England) Regulations 2008 (S.I. 2008/1881, amended by S.I. 2008/2269) which enforce Regulation (EC) No 999/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down rules for the prevention, control and eradication of certain transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (OJ No L 147, 31.5.2001, p1) as amended.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Appeals) (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in connection with appeals to the Scottish Ministers under sections 47, 130, 154, 169 and 180 of the Town and Country Planning (Scotland) Act 1997 (c. 8) (“the Act”) and in relation to the procedure for dealing with applications called-in for determination by the Scottish Ministers by virtue of a direction under section 46 of the Act. These Regulations apply to appeals where the notice of appeal is given on or after 3rd August 2009.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Schemes of Delegation and Local Review Procedure) (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in connection with the preparation and content of schemes of delegation under section 43A(1) of the Town and Country Planning (Scotland) Act 1997 (c. 8) (“the Act”) and the procedure for reviews held by virtue of section 43A(8) of the Act.

entry.title: The Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and remake with amendments The Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 (S.R. 2006 No. 202 as amended), which enforced Regulation (EC) No 999/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down rules for the prevention, control and eradication of certain transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (O.J. No. L 147, 31.5.2001, p.1) as amended (“the Community TSE Regulation”). These Regulations implement Commission Decision 2007/411 prohibiting the placing on the market of products derived from bovine animals born or reared within the United Kingdom before 1st August 1996 for any purpose and exempting such animals from certain control and eradication measures laid down in Regulation (EC) No. 999/2001 and repealing Decision 2005/598 (O.J. No. L 155, 15.6.2007, p.74). The Regulations also revoke The Bovine Products (Restriction on Placing on the Market) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (S.R. 2005 No. 515 as amended).

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the manner in which applications for planning permission, for approvals required by a condition imposed on a grant of planning permission in principle and for certificates of lawful use and development under the Town and Country Planning (Scotland) Act 1997 (“the Act”) are to be made. These Regulations apply to all applications made on or after 3rd August 2009. The also apply to the limited extent provided for in Part 11 in respect of applications made before that date but not yet determined by that date.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Sheriff Court European Small Claims Procedure Rules) 2008
entry.summary: (This note is not part of the Act of Sederunt)

entry.title: The Housing Benefit (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Housing Benefit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 and the Housing Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006.

entry.title: Electricity (Guarantees of Origin of Electricity Produced from Renewable Energy Sources) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Electricity (Guarantees of Origin of Electricity Produced from Renewable Energy Sources ) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 which provide for certificates guaranteeing the origin of electricity generated from renewable sources to be issued to generators by the Northern Ireland Authority for Utility Regulation on request.

entry.title: The Charities Act 1993 (Exception from Registration) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: Section 3A(1) of the Charities Act 1993 (“the 1993 Act”) imposes a general requirement that every charity in England and Wales must be registered in the register of charities which is maintained by the Charity Commission. Section 3A(2) of the 1993 Act makes provision for various charities to be excepted from this general requirement to register. The charities excepted from this requirement include those which are so excepted by regulations made by the Minister for the Cabinet Office. Section 3A(4)(b) of the 1993 Act requires the Minister to make regulations to ensure that certain charities are excepted from this requirement.

entry.title: The Charities Act 2006 (Commencement No. 5, Transitional and Transitory Provisions and Savings) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Charities Act 2006. The provisions specified in the Schedule to this Order are brought into force on 31st January 2009, subject to the transitional and transitory and savings provisions specified in articles 3 to 17 of this Order.

title.div: The Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (Wales) (Amendment) (No.2) Regulations 2008 / Rheoliadau Enseffalopathïau Sbyngffurf Trosglwyddadwy (Cymru) (Diwygio) (Rhif 2) 2008

div.p: These Regulations amend the Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies (Wales) Regulations 2008 (S.I. 2008/3154 (W.282)) which enforce Regulation (EC) No 999/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down rules for the prevention, control and eradication of certain transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (OJ No L 147, 31.5.2001, p.1) as amended.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Enseffalopathïau Sbyngffurf Trosglwyddadwy (Cymru) 2008 (O.S. 2008/3154 (Cy.282)) sy'n gorfodi Rheoliad (EC) Rhif 999/2001 Senedd Ewrop a'r Cyngor sy'n gosod rheolau ar gyfer atal, rheoli a chael gwared ar enseffalopathïau sbyngffurf trosglwyddadwy penodol (OJ Rhif L 147, 31.5.2001, t.1) fel y'i diwygiwyd.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Sheriff Court European Order for Payment Procedure Rules) 2008
entry.summary: (This note is not part of the Act of Sederunt)

entry.title: The Christmas Bonus (Specified Sum) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order provides that for the year 2008 the sum which is payable by way of Christmas bonus under section 148 (entitlement of pensioners to Christmas bonus) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (c. 4) is increased from £10 to £70.

entry.title: The Kaupthing Singer & Friedlander Limited (Determination of Compensation) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Kaupthing Singer & Friedlander Limited (Determination of Compensation) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order is made under the Banking (Special Provisions) Act 2008 (c. 2).

entry.title: The Rates of Child Benefit (Commencement) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order provides that different rates of child benefit prescribed under the Child Benefit (Rates) (Amendment) Regulations 2008 shall come into force on 5th January 2009.

entry.title: The Heritable Bank plc (Determination of Compensation) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Heritable Bank plc (Determination of Compensation) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order is made under the Banking (Special Provisions) Act 2008 (c. 2).
